channel.title: Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on
channel.description: Recent content in Fabrice Popineau @ CentraleSupelec on

item.title: Research
item.description: Topics My main research aims at using artificial intelligence techniques to optimize human learning. In this current era where digital access to knowledge is cheap and user attention is expensive, a number of online applications have been developed for learning. These platforms collect a massive amount of data over various profiles, that can be used to improve learning experience: intelligent tutoring systems can infer what activities worked for different types of students in the past, and apply this knowledge to instruct new students.

item.title: Publications
item.description: (save-excursion (ignore-errors (load-library "org-bibtex") (switch-to-buffer (find-file-noselect "~/Org/popineau/Publications.org")) (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-TeXLive.bib" "TeX") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-journal-temp.bib" "journal+EIAH|journal+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" " " "-ob" "popineau/Publications-journal.bib" "popineau/Publications-journal-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-inbook-temp.bib" "inbook+EIAH|inbook+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-inbook.bib" "popineau/Publications-inbook-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-conf-temp.bib" "conf+EIAH|conf+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-conf.bib" "popineau/Publications-conf-temp.bib") (org-bibtex "~/Org/popineau/Publications-poster-temp.bib" "poster+EIAH|poster+IR|crossref") (call-process "bib2bib.exe" nil (get-buffer-create (make-temp-name "*bib2bib-*")) nil "-c" "keywords : \"EIAH\\|IR\"" "--expand-xrefs" "-ob" "popineau/Publications-poster.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Current Courses since 2018 – Algorithmics and Complexity. 1st year course. CentraleSupélec, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2019 – Artificial Intelligence. 2nd year elective course. CentraleSupélec, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2020 – Knowledge Representation and Reasoning. 3rd year specialization course, together with Prof. Yolaine Bourda, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2020 – Automata and Languages Theory. 3rd year course, together with Prof. Pascale Le Gall and Marc Aiguier, Paris-Saclay campus. since 2020 – Logic modelling. 3rd year course, together with Prof.

item.title: CV
item.description: rd year option of Supelec about _[Computer Science and Knowledge Engineering](http://www.metz.supelec.fr/metz/fi/iic/Welcome.html)_ from 2005 to 2010. In 2010, I joined the Gif/Yvette campus of Supélec. In 2015, École Centrale de Paris and Supélec merged into CentraleSupelec, and I am now a member of the [LAHDAK](https://www.lri.fr/lahdak) team of the [LRI](https://www.lri.fr). I have recently been appointed by [AFNOR](https://norminfo.afnor.org/structure/afnorcn-jtc1sc-42/intelligence-artificielle/127690) as an expert member of the French National Body for [ISO/JTC1 SC42 on Artificial Intelligence](https://www.iso.org/committee/6794475.html). -- You can download my Resume / Vita / C.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence
item.description: The leading textbook about artificial intelligence by Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig has been translated to French. I supervised and participated to the French translation of the 2nd, 3rd and 4th editions together with Laurent Miclet. The 4th edition has benefited of careful and professional polishing and proofreading by Claire Cadet and the team in charge at Pearson France.

item.title: TeX related publications, presentations and seminars
item.description: Up to around 2005, I have devoted a great part of my research time to facilitating the dissemination of TeX, resulting in a few TeX related publications. I have maintained the TeXLive distribution of TeX for Windows for about 10 years. This was a demanding but rewarding collaborative work. I have (co-)organized the 2005 EuroTeX meeting in Pont-à-Mousson with Donald E. Knuth and Hermann Zapf as guests. The full proceedings of the conference are available online.
